data: PED ENDO Diabetes Mellitus Pre Procedure (Major) Management

This order set applies to:
- Patients with diabetes (e.g. type 1 diabetes, type 2 diabetes, medication-induced diabetes, CF related diabetes) managed by insulin injections or insulin pump therapy
- Patients who are in good metabolic control and free of ketosis prior to surgery
- Procedure anticipated to be longer than 2 to 4 hours in duration or patient has delayed ability to resume oral intake post-operatively
qHS, 0200 hours and in the morning pre-procedure
q1h, while on IV Insulin Infusion

Notify Endocrinologist on-call if POC glucose whole blood less than 4 mmol/L or greater than or equal to 15 mmol/L pre-operatively. If blood glucose less than 4 mmol/L, treat for hypoglycemia. If blood glucose greater than 15 mmol/L check urine for ketones
For patients treated with insulin injections
Do not give insulin lispro (HUMALOG), insulin aspart (NOVORAPID), or non formulary rapid acting insulin unless discussed with the endocrinologist on call

If patient is taking insulin isophane (NPH), insulin detemir (LEVEMIR), insulin glargine (LANTUS or BASAGLAR) or non-formulary basal insulin in the evening, give insulin detemir (LEVEMIR) at bedtime prior to procedure
unit, subcutaneous, qHS, drug form: inj

If patient is taking insulin glargine (BASAGLAR or LANTUS) or non-formulary basal insulin in the morning only, discontinue morning insulin glargine (BASAGLAR or LANTUS) and do not give bedtime insulin detemir (LEVEMIR)
unit, subcutaneous, qHS, drug form: inj
Constant, Clinical event: surgery, Medication(s) to be held: insulin glargine (BASAGLAR or LANTUS or TOUJEO), Instructions: hold dose on the morning of procedure
For patients treated with insulin pump
Continue current insulin pump rates in the evening, overnight and into the morning of surgery and ensure that the insulin pump infusion site is secure, if applicable
